net.sourceforge.jasa.agent
Class AbstractTradingAgent

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.jabm.agent.AbstractAgent
      net.sourceforge.jasa.agent.AbstractTradingAgent
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, net.sourceforge.jabm.agent.Agent, net.sourceforge.jabm.event.EventListener, net.sourceforge.jabm.util.Parameterizable, net.sourceforge.jabm.util.Prototypeable, TradingAgent, MarketEventListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
FixedDirectionTradingAgent, SimpleTradingAgent
public abstract class AbstractTradingAgent
extends net.sourceforge.jabm.agent.AbstractAgent
implements TradingAgent, java.io.Serializable, net.sourceforge.jabm.util.Parameterizable, net.sourceforge.jabm.util.Prototypeable, java.lang.Cloneable

An abstract class representing a simple agent trading in a round-robin market. Traders of this type deal in a single commodity for which they have a well-defined valuation.

Version:
$Revision$
Author:
Steve Phelps
See Also:
Serialized Form

public double getLastPayoff()
Return the profit made in the most recent market round. This can be used as, e.g. input to a re-inforcement learning algorithm.

active

public abstract boolean active()
Determine whether or not this trader is active. Inactive traders do not place shouts in the market, but do carry on learning through their strategy.

Returns:
true if the trader is active.
